pr_title: 6163 New panel for type filtering in the geolocation tool

timeline.message: New panel for type filtering in the geolocation tool
6163: Icons for artifact types in geolocation

timeline.bodyText: the state of checkbox and label enabled should be the same as list.
timeline.author: kellykelly3

timeline.bodyText: Make sure to note in the method header that Icon maybe null.
timeline.author: kellykelly3

timeline.bodyText: Just to appease netbeans create a private init function and put setLayout and the adds in that function.  That will make the light bulbs in netbeans go away.
timeline.author: kellykelly3

replies.bodyText: @kellykelly3 and @ethteck, if the issue is a leaking this pointer, you need a method to create instances of the class via two stage construction.
replies.author: rcordovano

replies.bodyText: The issue complaining about  is calling functions that can be overridden in the constructor.
replies.author: kellykelly3

timeline.bodyText: My mistake, please change comment to "Update if other GPS artifacts are added"
timeline.author: kellykelly3
kellykelly3

timeline.bodyText: Why are you keeping count?  You are not adding the type unless count is greater than one.  I just don't think you need to keep count.
timeline.author: kellykelly3

replies.bodyText: We display the count for each artifact type in the UI, so that's why I'm keeping count here.
replies.author: ethteck

timeline.bodyText: Different OSs use different path separators, ie \ vs /.  use Paths.get instead
timeline.author: kellykelly3

timeline.bodyText: Make sure the method header is updated.
timeline.author: kellykelly3

timeline.bodyText: I am a little torn about whether to do this or include the types in the query.  Was there a reason that you didn't look at extending the query?  It might be too messy.  That figuring out the query was a pain.
timeline.author: kellykelly3

replies.bodyText: This just seemed like the right place to do type filtering. I don't really have a specific reason other than this seeming to be a good way to do it to me.
replies.author: ethteck

replies.bodyText: So you didn't look into adjusting the query at all?
replies.author: kellykelly3

replies.bodyText: I did, but I just settled on this. It sounds like you prefer I do the logic in the query?
replies.author: ethteck

replies.bodyText: After talking with Richard about issues related to the support of custom artifacts I think they way you are doing this sufficient for now.
replies.author: kellykelly3

timeline.bodyText:
This is missing TSK_EXIF_METADATA
Also as Ann points out in the Jira, using these hardcode types (which is my fault) makes it so that we cannot support custom artifacts).
timeline.author: kellykelly3

replies.bodyText: I'll add the other type for now. I guess we'll want to rethink this approach going forward
replies.author: ethteck

timeline.bodyText:
There are two issues there.   I get a NPE here.  When I step through the code icon path was

The use of File.separator is not correct here.  Since you are loading a resource from the jar file I don't believe that the direction of the slash is file dependent.
timeline.author: kellykelly3

replies.bodyText: If you need to put that / at the beginning of the image file path why is it not being done in getIconFilePath?  It does make sense that ever that calls that function would have to add a / at the beginning of the path.
replies.author: kellykelly3

replies.bodyText: Ah, I see. I'll look into this, thanks. Yeah the slash should be "/" and it should probably just happen in getIconFilePath. I excluded it from that because the original caller seemed to break when I added it there. But I'll dig into it more.
replies.author: ethteck

replies.bodyText: I believe I have fixed this @kellykelly3. Let me know if you continue to see the NPE.
replies.author: ethteck
